Author: irungentoo
Content:
Our threat model is an attacker that wants to read and record the contents of conversations between everyone, they have the ability to modify/add/remove and log any packets. We assume they do not have any access to the actual machines Tox is running on.

The main goal of Tox is to make it hard for a global threat to conduct mass surveillance on everyone at the same time without sacrificing performance.

If the majority of the people using Tox have "nothing to hide" and use it because it works better than skype, the minority that does need the crypto will be able to use it without being discriminated against.

Author: on_and_off
Content:
Yeah. It is understandable when you see where Photos is coming from.

Google+ has proven successful with photographs since it had (at least at the time) an very good picture experience and an interaction model that worked well for communities. So they doubled down on photo features (not to mention that according to rumors, Gundotra is supposedly prone to claim some projects for his division).

Now that we have a full fledged photo product, it may be time to : \n-separate it from Google+, even though g+ should still be backed by photos.\n-Merge as many google photo products as possible into this new experience.

Google has made some amazing work with auto awesome features (these automatic albums are slick) and the Photo editor, especially on mobile (where it is far from easy to build an editing pipeline, even if you use Renderscript).

Content:
link at the top...

"life the universe and technical interviews" http://diegobasch.com/life-the-universe-and-technical-interv....

Every solution has a loop 1 to 1000000 which is N but then they check every digit which is a log N making them N log N solutions. But there are Log N solutions that avoid checking every possibility.

Ex:

s dup if 10 /mod recurse + then ; : f 0 1000000 0 do i s 42 = if 1 + then loop ;

Author: SamuraiFromHell
Title: The result of many months hacking
Content:
So, my friend had a problem - he could not find a notes taking app that would fit his needs - it needed to be simple to use, fast and have personalization + the basic features.

So we went and made such an app. We could not decide on the name at first but we settled on QwickNote because it describes the app pretty good.

Here it is: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.arbezone.qwicknote

So if you are like my friend you could also try it out, some original stuff there.

It has folders, theme colors, one-click edit of notes, cool interface, Google Tasks sync, repeating reminders and some more.

Cheers

Author: up_and_up
Content:
Here is a list of the largest majority employee-owned companies in the USA: http://www.nceo.org/articles/employee-ownership-100.

That is companies that are >50% employee owned.

Companies marked with an asterisk are 100% employee-owned.

The biggest 100% employee-owned company is Lifetouch Photography in MN with 25,000 employees.

But Co-ops and employee owned companies are not the same thing.

I have worked for several small co-ops that used consensus decision making. While it is true that everyone has an equal voice the tendency is to listen more to people with more experience or expertise in the particular area being discussed. Also, there is a lot of delegation that happens where subgroups are formed so not everyone is deciding what type of toilet paper to buy or how exactly we should implement some minor detail. That being said sometimes random people come up with the best ideas, so it was helpful to have them involved.

I found consensus decision making to be a lengthy process but a rewarding one.
